document.discussion_title: Jewellery, two-wheeler stolen from two houses
document.topic_text: Updated: August 12, 2016 10:42 IST Jewellery, two-wheeler stolen from two houses Staff Reporter Tweet Sixty-eight sovereigns gold jewellery, some money and a motorbike were stolen from two houses in the city, on Wednesday night and Thursday morning. The Saravanampatti and Podanur police registered cases and were investigating. A. Aysha (75) of Phase-II in Kurichi Housing Unit was alone at home on Thursday morning when she was robbed off 30 sovereigns of gold jewellery. The police said that she was preparing food around 8 a.m. when the culprit covered her face using a cloth. The police said that the man whose face was masked tied the woman’s hands with a piece of cloth, took away the nearly eight-sovereign jewellery she was wearing and the rest from the almirah along with Rs. 10,000 in cash before fleeing the place on a two-wheeler in the victim’s house. In the other incident, 38 sovereigns gold jewellery was stolen from the house of a retired sub-inspector of police at 3{+r}{+d}Block, Tamil Nadu Housing Board Colony at Ganapathy Maa Nagar when the occupants had gone out during the late hours of Wednesday. The police said that it was a joint family and R. Balasundaram (70) lived there with his wife Vedhamani, sons Easter Raj and Anand and their families. It is learnt that on Wednesday the family went to church around 5.30 p.m. and on returning around five hours later they noticed the front door broken open. Unidentified persons also damaged two almirahs in the house and took away the jewellery. Finger print experts and the sniffer squad were pressed for service. Special teams were formed.
